Pre-Game Insights: England and New Zealand's last meeting in this format was an instant classic, a slow-burning epic which saw England's World Cup hopes go up in flames. This match is a must-win for England to stay alive in the tournament.
New Zealand have been hugely impressive in brushing Australia and Sri Lanka aside, and victory in Brisbane would seal for them a semi-final berth for the third successive T20 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England will be relying on Afghanistan beating Australia on Friday, before having to overcome Sri Lanka in their final fixture in Sydney.
Others: The match could be won and lost in the two powerplays. Trent Boult and Tim Southee, New Zealand's opening bowlers, have been lethal with the new ball since arriving in Australia, while England's top order is yet to fire. Finn Allen is the key wicket for New Zealand, as he can set the tone for their innings.
